recommended_treatment: Adjuvant vaginal brachytherapy (Category 2A) is recommended for stage IB endometrial cancer with LVSI.
description: Surgical pathology of a hysterectomy reveals a 5.2 cm FIGO grade 1 endometrioid endometrial carcinoma with 56% myometrial invasion and lymphovascular invasion, with negative margins and lymph nodes.
patient_notes: Your low‐grade endometrial cancer was completely removed with clear margins and no lymph node involvement. Because the tumor invaded more than half of the uterine muscle and lymphovascular invasion is present, your care team recommends a short course of internal vaginal radiation (brachytherapy) to reduce the chance of recurrence.

verification.assessment: The extraction captured the core pathologic findings accurately, but the treatment recommendation and patient‐facing summary need adjustment to reflect the presence of LVSI and guideline guidance against observation alone in this setting.

cancer_organ_type.issues: The report describes an endometrial carcinoma of the uterus. ‘Uterine cancer’ is acceptable although ‘endometrial cancer’ would be more specific.

cancer_subtype.issues: Matches ‘endometrioid type’ adenocarcinoma in the report.

figo_stage.issues: FIGO stage IB is correctly inferred from >50% myometrial invasion. The report itself did not list a FIGO stage but did list FIGO grade.

pathologic_stage.issues: Matches the AJCC notation ‘pTlc pN0 pMx’ in the report. (Note: T1c is not standard FIGO nomenclature but reflects what the report recorded.)

recommended_treatment.issues: For stage IB with lymphovascular invasion, NCCN guidelines favor adjuvant vaginal brachytherapy (Category 2A). Observation alone is generally reserved for very low‐risk patients without LVSI.

description.issues: Accurately summarizes size, grade, depth of invasion, LVSI status, margins, and node negativity.

patient_notes.issues: The note’s language about ‘very low risk’ surveillance is misleading given the presence of LVSI. A stronger recommendation for vaginal brachytherapy should be reflected.
